body_html: The convention seems to be using TENSORFLOW_SYSCL_NO_DOUBLE for defines passed from the outside (e.g. TENSORFLOW_USE_VERBS). For inside variables, I would recommend a single place that has the #ifdef switch and use a macro in the spirit of what @jwlawson suggested. Could you draft that?
body_text: The convention seems to be using TENSORFLOW_SYSCL_NO_DOUBLE for defines passed from the outside (e.g. TENSORFLOW_USE_VERBS). For inside variables, I would recommend a single place that has the #ifdef switch and use a macro in the spirit of what @jwlawson suggested. Could you draft that?
body: The convention seems to be using `TENSORFLOW_SYSCL_NO_DOUBLE` for defines passed from the outside (e.g. `TENSORFLOW_USE_VERBS`). For inside variables, I would recommend a single place that has the `#ifdef` switch and use a macro in the spirit of what @jwlawson suggested. Could you draft that?
